adventure_overview: You are about to go on an overnight campout. Sleeping in a tent, roasting marshmallows, and exploring nature are some of the best parts of being a Cub Scout. Before you go, make a list of what you need to bring. Your den leader and parent(s) will help you get ready. Each time you go camping, you can show you are a Wolf Scout by doing more on your own. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

requirements.text: Learn about the buddy system and how it works in the outdoors.

activities.name: Buddy Calls
activities.description: Cub Scouts find their buddy using animal sounds.

activities.name: Buddy Walk
activities.description: Learn buddy teamwork during this relay game.

requirements.text: Know the Cub Scout Six Essentials.

activities.name: Cub Scout Six Essentials Kim’s Game
activities.description: Play Kim’s game and learn the Cub Scout Six Essentials.

activities.name: Make a Cub Scout Six Essential Kit
activities.description: Cub Scouts create their own Cub Scout Six Essentials kit.

requirements.text: In addition to your Cub Scout Six Essentials, list the personal items you need for your campout.

activities.name: Packing Relay
activities.description: Cub Scout teams pack a backpack for a camping trip.

activities.name: What Would You Bring?
activities.description: Cub Scouts determine what is a “need” or “want” for a campout.

requirements.text: Attend a council or district Cub Scout overnight camp or attend a campout with your pack.

activities.name: Council Camping Wolf
activities.description: Go camping at your local council camp.
